tasks.task: Daiquiri development process on an alligator farm with emphasis on waste management.
subtasks: Conducting research on alligator farming practices.
Explaining the economic significance of alligators in farming, including leather, meat, novelty, and tourism.
Discussing alligator biology, including temperature regulation, digestive anatomy, and reproductive habits.
Describing alligator farming methods, including closed and open systems.
Detailing waste management practices on an alligator farm, including feces and urine handling.
Explanation of odor control efforts through wind direction monitoring and facility layout.
Presentation of a calcium phosphate precipitation system for odor reduction and nutrient solidification.
Presentation of anaerobic digestion techniques for organics reduction, followed by struvite precipitation.

tasks.task: Waste system evaluation for alligator farms.
subtasks: Assessing the effectiveness of waste management systems on alligator farms.
Analyzing the potential of anaerobic digestion in reducing organic waste from alligator farms.
Evaluating the benefits and drawbacks of struvite precipitation as a nutrient recovery method.

tasks.task: Nutrient management planning for alligator farms.
subtasks: Collecting and analyzing samples of alligator manure for nutrient composition.
Developing a plan to size appropriate waste treatment facilities.
Incorporating ASABE guidelines and best practices for alligator farm waste management.

tasks.task: Documentation and dissemination of alligator farming waste management knowledge.
subtasks: Preparing a companion fact sheet to the discussion.
Publishing the fact sheet through Oklahoma Cooperative Extension Service.
Sharing the findings through agricultural channels such as YouTube and conferences.
